sentences.en: EXMP : His speech to the new freshmen was painfully didactic.
sentences.cn: 他的演说对于新人来说是一种痛苦的说教.

sentences.en: He is more didactic in his approach to the learning process.
sentences.cn: 他在教学过程中侧重于灌输。

sentences.en: He mentioned in his paper the didactic tendency in Chinese literature.
sentences.cn: 他在论文中提到了中国文学中的道德说教倾向.

sentences.en: His novel has a didactic tone.
sentences.cn: 他的小说有一种道德说教的口吻。

sentences.en: I always found the teachings of the Catholic Church to be too didactic.
sentences.cn: 我总觉得天主教派的教义太过教条式.

sentences.en: I don't like her didactic way of explaining everything.
sentences.cn: 我不喜欢她那种像教小孩子一样解释一切的方法.

sentences.en: I don't like his didactic manner.
sentences.cn: 我不喜欢他好说教的态度.

sentences.en: Prejudice determines the relativity and absoluteness of understanding, which is a didactic unity of the two.
sentences.cn: 前见决定了理解的相对性,同时又决定了理解的绝对性, 理解是相对性与绝对性的辩证统一.

sentences.en: The book, which takes question - and - answer format, has a clipped, slightly didactic style.
sentences.cn: 本书采用问答体的形式, 言简意赅, 略带说教意味.

sentences.en: This novel was intended to be neither didactic nor aggressive.
sentences.cn: 这部书的本意,既不想教训人,也不想攻击人.

words.tran_cn: 启蒙主义；教训主义；教训癖

trans.tran_cn: 教学的，教导的，（指人）学究式的，迂腐的
trans.tran_en: speech or writing that is didactic is intended to teach people a moral lesson
